page.title: 03Hardwicke Village
page.content: Hardwicke is a small village 1.5 km North from the M5 motorway bridge.It is,and has stayed,a quiet friendly area for years.It has one public telephone on the village green, although most houses have their own telephone.There are about 25 houses. Some are over 200 years old.Most are Victorian and a few are post Second World war.Two houses are being built at the moment.The houses are made of stone or brick.The brick ones are the newest.The people in the village shop weekly in Cheltenham for food and household goods.Furniture is bought in Tewkesbury or Gloucester. They have a bus service which is provided by a private company called Swanbrook Coaches,on Tuesdays and Thursdays.Most children go to Bishops Cleeve school by a school bus.
